Ratings.comment: I am working with Dr. Hong as a piano performance major. Having studied with a collegiate professor from late elementary through high school, I'm used to having excellent instructors. Dr. Hong is a level above, and is bringing out aspects of my playing that I have not been told about before. I have so much respect for her!
No Comments

Dr. Hong is an excellent piano teacher and an all around great person.  She put alot of time and effort into preparing me for a recital and did it with utmost care.  She really knows how to bring out the best in her students and creates a very nice atmosphere in her studio.  I would definetely recommend her to any serious piano student.

If want to improve as a pianist, then you MUST study with Dr. Hong. Dr. Hong will take your pianistic skills and send them to the next level. She truly wants your playing to improve and encourages you to find your artistic voice. Her love is for the piano and she expects nothing but the best. You only get out as much as you put in.
No Comments
there is just so much wrong here, there isn't enough room to write it all. Trust me, if you are serious about piano and hope to improve while in college, look into attending another school.

I've studied with Dr. Hong for many months.  I find her to be an excellent professor.  She is helped quite a bit in becoming a better performer.  I feel that continued study with her will only increase my abilities.

Ignore the first two mistaken reviews. Dr. Hong does not cancel lessons all the time, if she does she defiently makes them up. She is also the most amazing teacher, and you can learn a great deal from her. She knows what she is doing, and she's very perceptive. She's also a really nice professor.
Used foul language in class. It was kind of weird. Other than that, pretty easy class. Class is not entirely necessary but good practice for writing long papers.

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Supply Chain Analytics: Matching Supply with Demand

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Supply Chain Analytics: Matching Supply with Demand

SEI.Subject: BUSOBA
SEI.Class Name: Supply Chain Analytics: Matching Supply with Demand

Ratings.comment: Dr. Mikkelson is crystal clear as a conductor in his teaching and stick waiving. On a personal matter, he favors some students over others. We have a player who commutes that has missed over half the rehearsals, but another person who has one gig or conference are not allowed to miss. If you do a lot of freelance work (or wish to), avoid taking.

He is the single best thing going for the OSU School of Music. He's an amazing trumpeter, the most thorough and precise conductor I've ever had, and a kind, warm man, full of integrity.  He is even helpful and generous after you graduate!

This professor is the most amazing instructor I have had during my seven years at OSU.  He cares deeply for his students, as well as for the material he is teaching.  Dr. Mikkelson is always prepared and conducts himself with generosity, humility, and integrity.  He is a great example to those who have the chance to be in the OSU Wind Symphony.
No Comments

While her critiques of your playing are sometimes harsh and difficult to handle, she only says what she needs to in order to help your playing improve. I was not very motivated before college, and as soon as I arrived, she pushed me to my limit. I am a better player because of her and am grateful for her careful and tedious instruction.

Dr. Tan is a wonderful teacher. I improved leaps and bounds while under her instruction. Just don't get discouraged; while she is sometimes a little harsh and seems stoic, it is all only to make sure you get the best use of your lesson time and there is no time wasted. Besides, improvement shouldn't hinge on how friendly/unfriendly your teacher is.

Dr. Tan is a top notch professor, both musically and intellectually.  She doesn't waste time; she's able to tell right away what needs improvement and also how to fix it. I've improved so much since I started studying with her. She expects hard work, but understands what it's like being a student. I respect her as a teacher and performer.

This woman made me hate the violin. She spends the lesson time making you feel stupid and worthless and keeps comparing herself to you instead of helping you improve. Everyone thinks that she is a great becuase of her flashy recitals but no one knows that she CANNOT TEACH. Avoid, go with the other guy.

She is an extremely nice teacher and incredibly invovled in what she teaches. But her classes so so boring, and there is so much reading to do. And for the final paper she gives you no direction and the topic is incredibly too broad. For the final exam, you basic have to re-read everything because she gives no studyguide. Avoid if you can.

Dr. F, even though Music 348 was a lot of work, is a great professor and was very enthusiastic. She is very fair in terms of grading, and very accessible and willing to help any student. Plus, no textbook! I highly recommend taking her classes!
Dr. F is very nice and extremely helpful.  she absolutely loves her class and knows so much about it.  there was never a question that I had that she couldn't answer!

I could have chosen nearly every tag. Dr. Rice is inspirational, and being in his studio will challenge you, but will force you to be the best vocalist you can be. He cares so much about his students. I never wonder what he is asking of me; he is very clear. He is extremely knowledgable. By far the best there is.
Simply the best there is. Period.
He definitely cares about his students and his teaching. I highly recommend him to anyone and everyone.
super teacher you wouldn't think you could find in a college
Very knowledgeable and dedicated teacher. A major teacher in the US and internationally.
Great teacher!
The only reason to be there.
He's a GREAT teacher - if you can get in with him.
the best

Best voice teacher in town. Excellent technique teacher without being overbearing or tiresome.  Best support as teacher.  His students work.  Only voice teacher at OSU who stands up for student rights.
I don't even study with him, but I can rate him! How bogus is this???!!!
The best teacher around. Bar none.
Love this man!  Wonderful friend and voice teacher.  If you haven't studied with Robin, you've missed out.
Really knows his stuff!  The best voice teacher I ever had. :)

He's one cool guy. New professor at OSU this year (AU15) so pretty chill. More concerned you learn the content than about grades. Midterms was last week and we still haven't gotten tests 1-3 back (or graded, I think). He dresses sharp too, very suave. Definitely is handsome and musical (same thing, right?)

Stanco is a great jazz theory teacher! He has a lot of charisma, is very approachable, and genuinely wants to share his love of jazz with students. The only downside to his class is that there is no textbook, so attendance is mandatory to learn the material. There is a lot of participation in class, but the atmosphere is very laid-backed. Love him!

Dr. Atkinson is a wonderful professor! He is very smart (a part of MENSA) but socially awkward. He had trouble the other day when he wasn't able to use the powerpoint. He may seem like a total klutz/ nerd, but he is right on top of things. Just do ALL of the reading and listening for the class and you are set. Hard teacher, but definitely worth it!
Class was great
very quirky and fun, but the tests were difficlut (particularly the listening aspect)
Worst teacher ever! He's so scatterbrained, it's impossible to study for the exams. The notes make no sense at all and the class is so boring! Whatever you do, don't take a class taught by Atkinson!!

Great professor. A lot of listening in this class but interesting discussions in lectures. The only bad thing is that he teaches the class vertically as far as genres and dates. You need to think vertically to be able to do the essays on the tests

I've never come across anyone so humbly brilliant in my life. The man thinks everyone else speaks fluent French, German, and Greek, but it's not beyond him to explain concepts more clearly. It's a great class taught by one of the greatest Musicology profs in the nation.

Having taken the class at another institution, I feel that Prof. Atkinson's version is much easier.  The class is not too difficult if you attend and listen to the discussions.  All the notes given in class are posted on-line, so you never have to worry about writing down everything.  Two books are required, but only the listening guide is used.

He is VERY smart...and that makes his class VERY hard. His tests were impossible...nothing he emphasized in class was on them, and he never seemed to care that people were not doing well on them. The class was miserable.
Absolutely brillant and a very nice guy

This man is an expert in medieval music, so it was very interesting to have him as a teacher for this course. His tests are hard, but it isn't terribly difficult to get an A. He is very helpful and willing to explain something to you until you understand. He is also very funny if you pay attention to what he's saying.
He's an extremely difficult professor, but he knows his stuff, really loves jazz, and is generally a really nice guy.
Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant.  Is very accomodating when you show interest in his subject. Tests are difficult, but not impossible.

Very Intelligent, he knows his stuff, but conveys it in the most boring manner possible. His tests are way too difficult and provides no study sheets, course packs, or anything to help students whatsoever.
Lock this man in a room and let him do research!  He's brilliant, but keep him out of the classroom!
Joe is so awesome.
Wonderful man who has great care for his students!

What a strange person... but yet, you know he cares about every one of his students. I grew attached to Joe while I was here and now I will miss him when I'm gone and graduated. He was helpful and inspiring, even though he can be quite a trip sometimes!
Fair grader on exam answers and research paper. All exam questions come from class lecture notes and examples used in class. Attendance is mandatory.

You only need to show up for recitation. The lectures were super boring and attendance wasn't graded on those days. The powerpoint slides were pretty difficult to understand, which meant I wound up buying the textbook. All music examples were taken directly out of the book. I overstudied for every exam- just know your geography and two instruments!

It's a very easy class. It's also a history class, and like most history classes, the professor makes or breaks how interesting it is. Professor Will is very knowledgeable, but it was near impossible to pay attention in his lectures, they were so boring. Easy gen ed, still need to study, but I wish I took something more interesting.

Will gives very boring lectures and is super unorganized in every aspect when it comes to tests, powerpoint, and paper guidelines. He is hard to follow and it is very boring to sit in lecture. I recommend taking a more interesting/fun class instead of this one if you are looking for an arts or global studies credit.

This class was not one of my favorites. Dr. Will seemed keen to teach his material, but the material was often so easy that classes were useless. His assigned readings are never tested on, and his tests are super easy. The class is manageable, but will be super boring.

Super boring lectures, no need to attend, just study the lecture notes on carmen and you'll get an A. Only downside is that there's an 8-10 page paper due during week 12 that's so open ended it's hard to figure out what to write about. I don't really like him and it's a boring class, but it's an easy GPA booster and a good way to knock out a gen ed

Easy class, but the lectures were incredibly long. He deserves to be rated higher overall, but what is hurting his rating is that the lectures are boring. 70% of your grade are 2 midterms and a final. The other 30% is class participation and a paper. The exams take 30-40 minutes and involve listening to a song and identifying to what culture it is.

Came in expecting it to be a very easy intro to music class. Needed an easy one for my Visual/PA requirement. It's a lot more information than I was expecting to have to memorize, and it's almost more of a history class than anything. Midterms aren't too bad, but short-answers (half the test) are graded tough & final is hard. Wouldn't recommend.
Overall good professor however lectures end up feeling extremely long. Ok to skip lectures and attend recitations only, but that just means more studying outside of class for you.

Dr. Will is obviously an expert in the subject.  He is courteous to all students and listens carefully to their questions.  Student participation is an integral part of this graduate course.  Expectations are clearly outlined in the course syllabus.

He's a genuinely nice guy and wants to teach, but some of the guidelines aren't clear. I asked if there was a rubric for the research paper, and he flat-out said that he didn't know what a rubric was. His accent is really unclear at first, but I got used to it after the first 2 weeks. The tests were oddly specific, but not too hard. Take good notes

The class was very informative/interesting, however Prof Will should not be teaching the class. Yes, he can play every instrument known to man, however he has an unknown accent and a monotone voice (ZZZZZZ). Attend recitation, go to lectures before exams, DONT choose performance for the final project, you'll get over a 100% in the class. Enjoy!

After the first midterm I stopped going to lectures. Really all you have to do to pass the class is go to recitation and then do the study guides right before the midterms (there are 2) and the final. The research paper was also very easy, this class is a super easy but boring GE. You don't need to buy the textbook for the class we don't us it.

Very hard to pay attention or learn much from this class. He is very unclear during lecture and about assignment requirements and due dates. I could probably learn more about the subject from Wikipedia articles than from going to class.

Knows a lot about the material, but cannot convey clearly to students. MUST GO TO LECTURE TO DO WELL!!! Otherwise, you will be lost on his tests. Easy class and interesting if you like Music from different cultures.

Very boring in lecture. Will lecture on the same topic for way too long. We ended up being 2 weeks behind because he doesn't get to the point. Also liked to do lecture right before the midterm, as in we show up to take a midterm and he wants to lecture for an hour. Interesting class, but not the best teacher.

I liked the class a lot, but I liked the subject too and already knew some about music.  It was really easy material and fun, Udo plays a lot of cool music, and then you write something about it.  I went high a lot, I loved it.

Though he proceeds with the best intentions, he is clueless when it comes to communicating with students in the 21st century. He tended to confuse when he meant to clarify, and say unhelpful things like "that's wrong" and read people's tests in front of everyone. Don't let the lack of structure fool you, though; lectures are important - TAKE NOTES!

Prof Will is very interested in the material, and very helpful. However, the material could be presented in a different manner to be more helpful. A lot of studying was required. Only 2 exams, a final and a paper make your grade, so you HAVE to do well on the exams
He's boring, but his tests are pretty easy.  But you HAVE to go to class, or you'll do horribly on his exams.
No Comments
No Comments

Professor Lindroth is a really great professor. Good guy, cares about your education, cares about your grade, and wants to see you succeed. Very interesting lectures and discussions. He often shows helpful/interesting videos during lectures. Does a good job setting forth what is expected/needed to achieve a high grade. Gives helpful feedback.
He has puns and he's really into music, has lots of good backstories / vaguely relevant fun facts .

This was a wonderful class and professor! As someone who does not know much about music, the music theory concepts were challenging at time, but Dr. Goecke broke it down and demonstrated the concepts well. I also enjoyed learning how the history of jazz connects to most of the music I like today. I highly recommend taking any class with Dr. Goecke.

Took him for Introduction to Jazz. He is very passionate about the music and has a lot of real world experience. He really works hard at designing solid lecture slides. Expects you to study for the tests and listen to jazz music a lot throughout your day.
He expects you to have the knowledge of someone with a PhD in jazz, and this is just a gen ed class...

It is clear that Dr. MacMullen is driven and incredibly talented in what she does. In rehearsal she is an effective conductor and personally is candid and inspiring. Furthermore, I admire her for the creativity and determination it probably takes to put together meaningful, empowering concerts.

Dr. MacMullen is an amazing teacher in my opinion.  It is easy to tell that she is an expert in what she does and is extremely talented.  I especially admire her ability to convey exactly what she expects a piece of music to sound like in a way that produces good results.
Dr. MacMullen is an incredible teacher and an amazing musician. However, she is not always clear in her instruction.

Dr. MacMullen is such a nice lady and a great musician, but don't expect to sit down and just sing songs. Be prepared to be completely focused each class and be on top of the music she gives you.  Depending on the year depends on how big of a commitment it is. She does make Women's Glee more than just the music, and also gives time to empower you.
Mr. Spearman seems like he tries his best to work with the required materials for aural skills. Be prepared for lots of assessments. He is nice but only worked with him over Zoom.

Oh my GOD this guy sucks. Doesn't post grades online ever, never responds to emails, and straight up LOST one of my assignments and never communicated with me after. He's also incredibly boring and the lectures are very long snooze-fests. Save yourself time, money and sanity and take literally any other class rather than be with this guy.

I wanted to enjoy Professor Tomasacci and his class, but I just never did. Class consisted mostly of very long, very boring lectures, made more boring by his monotone voice and general lack of enthusiasm. That being said, it was a very easy course and you should have no problems getting an A if you put in a tiny bit of work. Never needed textbook.

I really enjoyed this guy, a year later and his class is still influencing my taste in music and way of thinking. Textbook isn't totally necessary unless you want to review things covered in class. Just go to class, take notes, be engaged, and study, and you'll do fine and be left smiling.

Professor David is good guy outside the classroom, as a professor very unorganized. Emailed constantly for final grades never responded nor was my final grade posted on blackboard whatsoever during the whole semester. When i  if i was failing, he wasn't sure. Class would be canceled sometimes, lectures would get off topic

This is a very easy class as long as you show up. He gives notes before each quiz or test and if you read over those you will get an A. He's not very organized and changes the syllabus a lot but overall he's a great teacher and this a fun class and an easy A.

Mr. Tomasacci was my favorite teacher this semester. He gives out pop quizzes, which are easy to understand. He prepares you for all tests by explaining all terms on review in class. Would take again!

Interesting guy. Really cares about what he teaches and answers questions about music and art even if you're not talking about that topic in class. Doesn't post grades on Blackboard however. Class consists of weekly quizzes, but he's pretty generous with review guides. Reading assignments are never discussed in class.

Knows his material and loves it, but I do not recommend taking his class. Since the start of the semester, I have been having issues with him and posting quiz and exam reviews late. My final is this Thursday, and he still has not posted the review. Its infuriating. He cancelled so much material because of this lateness. Very irresponsible.

I didn't use the text, went off of his notes in class. Hard to copy them off the board bc his handwriting can be sloppy and he has arrows going everywhere. He posts a lot of unnecessary materials and tends to go on tangents a lot. He knows his stuff but is unable to stick to his syllabus. Several quizzes and a paper skipped. Does drop low grades.

Dr. Tomasacci is a brilliant musicologist and I'm sure any of his theory classes would be amazing. I took his music history class at CSCC and enjoyed it so much! He truly loves what he does and is so genuine. He wants the class to do well and makes it very easy to get an A. His music talent is unquestionable. It was a pleasure!
His awesomeness evades words.

The Tomasach is AWESOME! Take any opportunity to take his section. You will not regret it. One day, he cast a spell to make the rain stop during our midterm, and it worked. This is just one example of how far The Tomasach will go to help you succeed.

A great guy! Definitely interesting, and he's one you'll either love or hate. I loved him, you just gotta understand him. He's really cool and will help you at whatever level of theory you're at if you don't understand what's going on. And he looooves him some Star Wars...haha. He's a cutie. And totally awkward, which only adds to the funniness!
What an incredible teacher! What an incredible man!
Professor Haddad changed my life. What a wonderful man!

Prof. Baker is great. Personally I think her lectures cover ample material and the exams are fair. You'll get an A in this class simply if you show up and pay attention. Would recommend this course.

He's not hot lol. But he's so easy. You don't have to go to lecs but you should go to recitations. To pass exams just memorize everything.
